paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the effects of tafamidis on patients with the Val30Met mutation in the TTR gene, focusing on its long-term safety, tolerability, and efficacy. No other TTR variants are mentioned.

patients.demographics: Men and women with TTR-FAP, median age 37.5 years in tafamidis group, 36.0 years in placebo group

functional_data.summary: Tafamidis stabilizes the TTR tetramer, slowing disease progression.

variants.additional_notes: The study focuses on the Val30Met mutation and its response to tafamidis treatment.
key_quotes: Tafamidis, a transthyretin (TTR) kinetic stabilizer, delayed neuropathic progression in patients with Val30Met TTR familial amyloid polyneuropathy (TTR-FAP).
Men and women who had TTR-FAP with the Val30Met mutation and completed the month 18 visit of study Fx-005 were eligible.

tables_processed.table_caption: Baseline demographic and disease characteristics (intent-to-treat population)

challenges: No other TTR variants besides Val30Met were mentioned.
extraction_metadata.notes: The paper primarily discusses the Val30Met variant in the context of tafamidis treatment.
